text.div:
SituationalAwarenessforNovelEpidemicResponse

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.us.saner

The Situational Awareness for Novel Epidemic Response Implementation Guide enables transmission of high level situational awareness information from inpatient facilities to centralized data repositories to support the treatment of novel influenza-like illness.

name: SituationalAwarenessforNovelEpidemicResponse
title: Situational Awareness for Novel Epidemic Response
description: The Situational Awareness for Novel Epidemic Response Implementation Guide enables transmission of high level situational awareness information from inpatient facilities to centralized data repositories to support the treatment of novel influenza-like illness.

grouping.name: Behavior: Capability Statements
grouping.description: The following artifacts define the specific capabilities that different types of systems are expected to have in order to comply with this implementation guide.  Systems complying with the implementation guide are expected to declare conformance to one or more of the following capability statements.

grouping.name: Structures: Resource Profiles
grouping.description: These define constraints on FHIR resources that need to be complied with by conformant implementations

grouping.name: Structures: Data Type Profiles
grouping.description: These define constraints on FHIR data types that need to be complied with by conformant implementations

grouping.name: Structures: Extension Definitions
grouping.description: These define constraints on FHIR data types that need to be complied with by conformant implementations

grouping.name: Terminology: Value Sets
grouping.description: These define sets of codes used by systems conforming with this implementation guide

grouping.name: Terminology: Code Systems
grouping.description: These define new code systems used by systems conforming with this implementation guide

grouping.name: Example: Example Instances
grouping.description: These are example instances that show what data produced and consumed by systems conforming with this implementation guide might look like

resource.name: Audit Event Write Profile
resource.description: Defines constraints on the AuditEvent Resource to record when a resource has been written.

resource.name: MeasureCriteria
resource.description: Constraints on documentation for the evaluation of a Measure

resource.name: Saner Measured Item Description
resource.description: A CodeableConcept describing the item to be counted in terms of the type of FHIR Resource to count, and subtype of item identified by that resource

resource.name: Precise Date Time
resource.description: A dateTime value that contains seconds and a timezone

resource.name: Audit Event Read
resource.description: Defines constraints on the AuditEvent Resource to record when a record has been accessed.

resource.name: Saner Public Health Measure
resource.description:
Profile Saner Public Health Measure
Mixins: SanerStructureDefinitionContent

The Public Health Measure Profile ensures that Measures are very well defined as an aid to automation
of measures.  These are developed by The Saner Project team to ensure that the measure is well understood
and computation of it can be automated from systems that have the measure data.

resource.name: Saner Public Health Measure Report
resource.description:
Profile Saner Public Health Measure Report

The Public Health Measure Report Profile ensures that MeasureReports conforms to the minimal content required to properly interpret
a report of a Public Health Measure.

resource.name: Saner Public Health Measure Stratifier
resource.description:
Profile Saner Public Health Measure Stratifier

A stratifier is effecitively a mixin that can be used with an existing measure
to add stratification detail to that measure.

resource.name: Resource Location Profile
resource.description: Defines constraints on the Location Resource describing the location of resources (Beds and Devices).

resource.name: Supporting Device Profile
resource.description: Defines constraints on the Device Resource for data communicating about supporting devices.

resource.name: Extension Attributes to associate with a Location Reference to simplify Geographic search
resource.description:
This is essentially a database denormalization that facilitates search by Geographics coordinates on a location.
It enables a FHIR Server to implement search on a MeasureReport by GeoLocation using an extension.
The extension is purposefully designed to duplicate the existing [FHIR GeoLocation Extension](http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/geolocation)
in the hope that it could eventually be absorbed by that extension.

resource.name: Attributes describing a group of measures
resource.description: Attributes describing the group of measures

resource.name: Alternate criteria for performing a measure
resource.description: Provides Alternate criteria for performing a measure, (e.g., CQL, Drules, et cetera)

resource.name: Bed Location Operational Status
resource.description: This Value Set is used to indicate whether a bed is in use (O), available for use (U), or not available (C) for use.

resource.name: Bed Location Types
resource.description: Codes used to identify types of service locations for beds

resource.name: Bed Property
resource.description: This value set describes other properties of a bed, such as the ability to support isolation.

resource.name: Bed Type of Care
resource.description: This Value Set describes the types of care services that a bed can support.

resource.name: C19HCC Confirmed COVID19 Infection
resource.description:
**Purpose:**

Clinical Focus:

This value set contains conditions associated with a confirmed diagnosis of COVID-19.

Data Element Scope:

Used to identify patients with a confirmed COVID-19 infection.

Inclusion Criteria:

Conditions associated with confirmed COVID-19 infection, including laboratory-confirmed COVID (symptomic or asymptomatic).

Exclusion Criteria:

Suspected, possible or probable COVID-19, or possible exposure to COVID-19 without a definitive COVID-19 diagnosis.

resource.name: C19HCC Hydroxychloroquine
resource.description:
**Purpose:**

Clinical Focus:

This value set contains branded and non-branded hydroxychloroquine medications.

Data Element Scope:

Used to identify patients who had hydroxychloroquine as an active medication on their medication list or who were administered hydroxychloroquine during a hospitalization.

Inclusion Criteria:

Branded and non-branded medications with hydroxychloroquine as an ingredient. RxNorm term types: SCD\/GPCK, SBD\/BPCK, SCDG, BCDG, SCDC, BCDC, IN, PIN, BN.

Exclusion Criteria:

none

resource.name: C19HCC SARSCoV2 Exposure
resource.description:
**Purpose:**

Clinical Focus:

This value set contains conditions indicating the patient may have been exposed to SARS-CoV-2.

Data Element Scope:

To identify patients exposed or with a suspicion of exposure to SARS-CoV-2, whether associated with a suspicion of COVID-19 infection or not.

Inclusion Criteria:

Conditions indicative of possible exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

Exclusion Criteria:

: Conditions representing suspicion or confirmation of COVID-19.

resource.name: C19HCC Suspected COVID19 Infection
resource.description:
**Purpose:**

Clinical Focus:

Conditions indicative of a possible COVID-19 infection but no definitive COVID-19 diagnosis.

Data Element Scope:

Used to identify patients suspected to have COVID-19.

Inclusion Criteria:

Includes conditions indicative of a possible COVID-19 diagnosis.

Exclusion Criteria:

Conditions associated with a confirmed COVID-19 infection.

resource.name: COVID-19 Diagnostic Test
resource.description: Codes for COVID-19 Diagnostic Tests

resource.name: Confirmed COVID-19 Diagnosis
resource.description: Codes confirming COVID-19 Diagnostic Test Result

resource.name: Confirmed COVID-19 Diagnosis Values
resource.description: Codes for result values confirming COVID-19 Diagnostic Test Result

resource.name: Age Brackets By Decade
resource.description: A Value Set of age groups generally by decade except youth (under 20), or over 80, commonly used for stratification in public health dashboards

resource.name: ED or Overflow Locations
resource.description: Codes used for ED or Overflow locations

resource.name: Resource Fields
resource.description: This value set describes fields used to stratify groups in a report

resource.name: Resource Fields for Device
resource.description: Field names in the Device Resource

resource.name: Resource Fields for Location
resource.description: Field names in the Location Resource

resource.description: Codes used for ICU locations

resource.name: Inpatient Locations
resource.description: Codes used for inpatient locations

resource.name: Measure Groups
resource.description: Measure Groups defined by the SANER Project

resource.name: Measure Populations
resource.description: Measure Populations defined by The SANER Project

resource.name: Measure Rate Aggregation Value Set
resource.description: This Value Set Identifies methods of rate aggregation

resource.name: Measure Status Values
resource.description: Allowed Status Values for Saner Measures

resource.name: Occupied Bed
resource.description: Codes used for Occupied Beds

resource.name: Patient Died
resource.description: Codes used to identify that a patient has died

resource.name: Age Brackets By Score (20)
resource.description: A Value Set of age groups in 20 year increments used in some public health dashboards

resource.name: Suspected Or Diagnosed COVID-19
resource.description: Coded identifying suspected or confirmed COVID-19

resource.name: Ventilator Devices
resource.description: Codes used for Ventilator Devices

resource.name: Ventilator Devices when used with Tracheostomy
resource.description: Codes used for Devices that support Ventilation with a Tracheostomy

resource.name: Age Bracket System
resource.description: A Code System for Stratifying by Age Bracket defined by The SANER Project

resource.name: Bed Type Coding System
resource.description: This Coding System fills gaps describing types of care services that a bed can support.

resource.name: Measure Group System
resource.description: A Code System for Groups defined by The SANER Project

resource.name: Measure Population System
resource.description: A Code System for Populations defined by The SANER Project

resource.name: Measure Rate Aggregation Coding System
resource.description: This Coding System Identifies methods of rate aggregation

resource.name: Questionnaire CDC System
resource.description: A Code System for questionnaire fields defined by the CDC used in The SANER Project

resource.name: Questionnaire FEMA System
resource.description: A Code System for questionnaire fields defined by FEMA used in The SANER Project

resource.name: Resource Fields for Device
resource.description: This Coding System identifies legal field names in a FHIR R4 Device Resource.

resource.name: Resource Fields for Location
resource.description: This Coding System identifies legal field names in a FHIR R4 Location Resource.

resource.name: CDC Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity
resource.description: This measure demonstrates reporting on bed availability and use at a facility location based on CDC/NHSN reporting requirements.

resource.name: Computable CDC Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity
resource.description: This measure demonstrates reporting on bed availability and use at a facility location based on CDC/NHSN reporting requirements.

resource.name: Computable FEMA Laboratory Orders and Results Daily Increase Reporting
resource.description: This measure demonstrates reporting about Daily Laboratory Testing at a inpatient test sites capturing laboratory orders and results daily increase and cumulative counts.

resource.name: Search by Code in Definitions and Instances
resource.description: This SearchParameter enables resources used in The SANER Project to be discovered by codes or valueSets used in the resource including those in any extensions.

resource.description: This SearchParameter enables definition resources used in The SANER Project to be discovered from text used in the resource definition.
